title: Lonzo Ball, out since last year, may miss all of next season as he undergoes third knee surgery: report
description: The current NBA season isn't even over, but Lonzo Ball's 2023-24 season is already reportedly in jeopardy as he is set to undergo a third knee surgery.

title: Biden's men's March Madness bracket busted after Princeton shocks Arizona: 'Shouldn't sleep on Jersey'
description: President Biden was likely just as shocked as any other bettor in the U.S. Thursday evening after Princeton upset Arizona and busted his bracket.

title: Big Scoop: Latest media hit job on DeSantis reveals how he eats pudding
description: Reporter Jake Lahut's big scoop in his anti-DeSantis article was former staffers alleging that the Florida Republican governor eats pudding with his fingers.

title: Chicago Public Schools sued by parents of special needs students claiming teacher abused students
description: Eight parents of special needs children are suing the Chicago Public School system, claiming that a teacher physically abused their young children by hitting them with wooden rulers

title: Democrat Marianne Williamson defends challenging Biden in 2024: This country needs an 'economic U-turn'
description: 2024 Democratic presidential candidate Marianne Williamson broke down her decision to run for president in 2024 and called on President Biden to debate her should he run for re-election on "Your World with Neil Cavuto."

title: Canada to remove mandatory COVID testing requirements for travelers from China
description: Canada is removing its mandatory COVID-19 testing requirements for air travelers from China. Changes are due to improvement in case numbers.

title: Indianapolis man arrested for killing teen in January mall shooting
description: Clyde Johnson, 19, of Indianapolis, was arrested for a January mall shooting that killed 16-year-old Michael Mason Jr. and wounded an unnamed adult.

title: Michigan loses appeal over former governor's acquittal in Flint water case
description: The Michigan Court of Appeals sided with former Republican Gov. Rick Snyder in an appeal over his acquittal ofn charges related to his alleged role in the Flint water crisis.

title: School district removes 'sexual' book series about students attempting to assassinate their alien teacher
description: A public school district in Wisconsin told Fox News Digital Thursday that a recently added a book series, which parents criticized as both violent and sexual, would no longer be available in its e-library.

title: Michigan boater who disappeared after vessel capsized found dead
description: A Michigan man was found dead more than a month after he went missing while boating on a river.

title: Princeton shocks Arizona, pulls off late run for biggest March Madness upset thus far
description: The Princeton Tigers shocked the college basketball world as the No. 15 seed took down the No. 2 seed University of Arizona Wildcats, 59-55, in the First Round.

title: How Zoom will help MLB umpires make replay calls in 2023 season
description: MLB umpires will have another technological advancement to help them get the right calls in the 2023 season as Zoom provides video evidence on-field in replay situations.

title: Dutch hospitals hold 24-hour strike for 10% pay increase, better conditions
description: Dutch hospitals are holding a 24-hour strike for a 10% pay increase and better conditions. Labor unions are in talks with hospitals trying to improve salaries and reduce workloads.

title: FDA advisers vote in favor of full approval for Pfizer's COVID pill Paxlovid
description: U.S. health regulators voted in favor of a full approval for Pfizer's COVID pill Paxlovid. This pill will will help adults who are at high risk of progression to severe virus.

title: Alabama basketball player strongly denies being at the scene of deadly shooting: '100% inaccurate'
description: Alabama freshman walk-on Kai Spears has disputed a report published by The New York Times that placed him at the scene of a fatal January shooting.

title: Pregnancy-related deaths in US surged during pandemic
description: Pregnancy-related deaths in the United States surged during the pandemic. UN agnecies reported that a spike in maternal mortality rates occurred in all parts of the world in 2020.

title: Texas grandma, granddaughter killed in crash involving human smuggler: 'Enough is enough'
description: A 71-year-old Texas grandma and her 7-year-old granddaughter were killed after being struck by a driver who was evading authorities while smuggling 11 illegal migrants in his vehicle.

title: Boston pizzeria owner accused of verbally, physically abusing employees
description: Boston pizzeria owner Stavros Papantoniadis is accused of forced labor, as well as verbally and physically abusing multiple illegal immigrant employees.

title: Mississippi 3-year-old leads Louisiana deputies to mom, sisters who drowned in Gulf of Mexico
description: Mississippi resident Samantha Alexander and two of her children drowned on a Louisiana beach in Cameron Parish, according to authorities. Her 3-year-old son led deputies to the scene.

title: San Diego State holds on late to avoid upset against Charleston
description: The fifth-seeded San Diego State Aztecs almost were the victims of the second upset in as many games in Orlando, but they survived and advanced.

title: 3 dead in rioting blamed on gangs in Brazil's northeast
description: Riots in Brazil's northeast, blamed on imprisoned gang members, have left three dead. Most of the violence has been located in the state of Rio Grande do Norte.

title: Boxers from Russia, Belarus to compete at women's world championship with flags
description: Russian and Belarusian athletes competing at the Women's World Boxing Championships this week will do so while being able to represent their nations.

title: Alabama routs Texas A&M-CC despite Brandon Miller going scoreless
description: Brandon Miller finished the game scoreless, but Alabama still managed to top Texas A&M-CC 96-75 in the first round of March Madness on Thursday.

title: NC Gov. Cooper urges against large paper mill's closure
description: Democratic North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper urged Pactiv Evergreen not to shut down its Canton mill, noting the "devastating effect" an estimated 1,100 job losses would have on the state.

title: Mar-a-Lago staffers subpoenaed for Trump classified document investigation
description: Staffers at the Palm Beach, Florida Mar-a-Lago resort were subpoenaed on Thursday as part of an investigation into former President Trump's handling of classified documents.

title: Ben Affleck explains why he looked miserable at the Grammys
description: Ben Affleck cleared things up about his "miserable" Grammy meme moments with wife Jennifer Lopez in a new interview. He explained what really went down as cameras were rolling.

title: College students and universities ditching humanities majors in order to prepare for 'in-demand careers'
description: College students are choosing to forego humanities majors in favor of more practical options with experts citing high costs and an aversion to partisan ideology

title: Wisconsin Democrats propose near-elimination of cash bail
description: Democrats in the Wisconsin Legislature have introduced a proposal to almost completely eliminate cash bail, replacing it with a risk assessment system.

title: 'Wheel of Fortune' fans slam game show mistake that left viewers confused
description: "Wheel of Fortune" fans were left confused after the game show had different amounts listed on the scoreboard for one player during its most recent episode.

title: Army investigating soldier's death at Texas military post
description: The Army is investigating the death of a soldier at a Texas military post. Fort Hood has struggled with cases of suicide, homicide, and sexual assault.

title: Michigan woman who fled to Thailand after college student's hit-and-run death to be arraigned
description: A Michigan woman who allegedly fled to Thailand after she was accused of being involved in a fatal hit-and-run that left a college student dead on New Year's Day will be arraigned on Friday.

title: US judge seeks plan to protect humpback whales from fishery
description: A United States judge wants a plan to protect the humpback whales from fisheries. The National Marine Fisheries Service kills an an average of one humpback whale per year.

title: What To Do About SVB?
description: The collapse of Silicon Valley Bank have lawmakers and policy figures grasping for answers. There’s little consensus as to what lawmakers may do in response – if anything.

title: 'Parents' bill of rights' passes New Hampshire Senate
description: A "parents' bill of rights," which would oblige educators to disclose students' LGBTQ inclinations to their legal guardians, has passed the New Hampshire Senate.

title: Kansas powers past Howard in March Madness game without Bill Self
description: Kansas was without Bill Self at the helm for Thursday's game against Howard but it didn't matter as the Jayhawks won 96-68 over the Bison.

title: Avril Lavigne environmental protester defends topless stunt: 'We created an international buzz'
description: Environmental protester Casey Hatherly explained why she took the stage topless during the 2023 Juno Awards in front of singer Avril Lavigne on Monday.

title: Border Patrol terror watch-list encounters on track to outpace last year’s record
description: The number of people on the FBI's Terrorist Screening Database encountered between ports of entry at the southern border is on pace to eclipse last year's numbers.

title: ACLU of Alaska sues over prison involuntary medication rules
description: ACLU of Alaska asked a judge to overturn a prison policy on involuntary medication. A lawsuit was filed against state corrections on behalf of a man who was forcibly injected with medication.

title: Moldovan legislators pass bill to make Romanian national language
description: Lawmakers in Moldova passed a bill Tuesday that would change all references to the Moldovan language in the nation's constitution to Romanian.

title: Montenegro's president dissolves parliament, sets stage for early elections
description: Montenegrin President Milo Djukanovic dissolved parliament Thursday, ahead of what is anticipated to be an early federal election in the near future.

title: New Jersey suspect seen shoving dead cat in mailbox: Video
description: Cranford, New Jersey police are searching for a suspect who was videotaped putting a dead cat in a resident's mailbox. Police believe the cat may have been struck by a car.

title: Chargers' Nasir Adderley, 25, retires after 4 seasons to prioritize health
description: Los Angeles Charges Nasir Adderley is retiring after four seasons, the 25-year-old safety announced on Instagram Thursday.

title: Reddit user sparks heated debate about rushing to leave airplane upon landing: 'Just rude'
description: A Reddit user sparked a debate about deplaning etiquette after asking if it was wrong to take a backpack and rush to get off the plane. Plenty of others weighed in.

title: Fox News' Benjamin Hall credits his wife Alicia for extraordinary recovery from near-fatal attack in Ukraine
description: Benjamin Hall, who was significantly injured while covering Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, believes his wife, Alicia, should be getting all the credit for his extraordinary recovery.

title: Michigan public works chief gets 3 months for extorting, threatening developer
description: Former Macomb County Public Works Commissioner Anthony Marrocco has been sentenced to three months in custody Thursday for politically-charged threats against a developer.

title: Princess Leonor of Spain gears up for 3-year military training
description: Princess Leonor of Spain, heir to the throne, is following in the footsteps of her father, King Felipe VI. Her grandfather, Juan Carlos I, abdicated the throne in 2014.

title: Pennsylvania man pleads guilty to pulling a blowtorch and driving into officers: 'I was doing drugs'
description: A Reading, Pennsylvania man pleaded guilty in court on Thursday to threatening to use a blowtorch on officers and driving a vehicle into them before getting shot multiple times.

title: 'Evil Dead' star Bruce Campbell boots heckler from film premiere: Get the f-- outta here!'
description: "Evil Dead" star Bruce Campbell kicked a heckler out the SXSW premiere of his new horror film "Evil Dead Rise," telling the theatergoer to "Get the f*** out of here!"

title: What happened to the woman who called being homeless in Portland a ‘piece of cake’?
description: Wendy's tongue-in-cheek description of homelessness in Portland as a "piece of cake" went viral. Then her siblings saw the video and went looking for their sister.

title: Reporters erupt on Jean-Pierre over Biden not taking questions from press pool: 'That's not true'
description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre was peppered by reporters after she claimed they would have the opportunity to ask President Biden questions during an upcoming meeting.

title: Senate advances bill to repeal decades-old Iraq war authorizations
description: The Senate advanced a bill to repeal two war authorizations against Iraq on Thursday, something some said is long overdue.

title: Florida GOP lawmakers advance 6-week abortion ban with some exceptions
description: Florida' Republican-led House Healthcare Regulation Subcommittee on Thursday voted along party lines to advance a six-week abortion ban.

title: Boston eyes fossil fuel limits on new constructions
description: Boston Mayor Michelle Wu filed an ordinance seeking green energy requirements for all future building constructions in the city, part of a broader initiative to eliminate fossil fuels.

title: Maui businessman sued for $2M after grounding luxury yacht, spilling fuel into waters
description: A Maui businessman is being sued for $2 million after running aground a luxury yacht and spilling diesel fuel into waters. The man will have to pay millions of dollars in damages.

title: 14-year-old boy arrested in Mexico for drug-related murder of 8
description: A 14-year-old boy was arrested in Mexico for a drug-related killing of eight people. The boy allegedly opened fire on the family while he was driving on a motorcycle.

title: Kentucky University agrees to $14M settlement in wrestler's death
description: A Kentucky university agreed to pay a $14 million settlement in the death of a wrestler during practice. The university will engage in a heat-illness training program.

title: Army to remove Fort Jackson soldier accused of hijacking bus while AWOL after insanity verdict
description: The Army is kicking out Jovan Collazo, the 25-year-old Fort Jackson private accused of taking off in spring of 2021 and hijacking a school bus at gunpoint.

title: Army moving forward with new weapons, will test in various environments
description: The Army will test its new adopted weapons those summer in various environmental conditions

title: Conservative Wisconsin Chief Justice re-elected to second term
description: Conservative Wisconsin Supreme Court Chief Justice Annette Ziegler has been re-elected to a second two-year term helming the high court by her fellow justices.

title: Kansas legislators struggle to thwart 'woke' ESG investment by state
description: Discord among Kansas Republicans on technicalities of a potential ban on ESG investment by the state has so far prevented legislation from being passed.

title: Pentagon says its ‘highly unlikely’ Russia will find anything useful if it recovers US drone from Black Sea
description: The Pentagon says it is highly unlikely it will find any useful information if it recovers the downed U.S. drone from the depths of the Black Sea.

title: County officials call for changes to 'insensitive' New Jersey seal over gun violence
description: Union County officials in New Jersey may redesign their seal, claiming the historic imagery could be "insensitive" in today's climate of gun violence.

title: Schools stockpile Narcan as overdose deaths skyrocket: California mom blames Biden border policies
description: Fourteen school districts in Orange County now have the overdose-reversing drug on hand as drugs continue to pour into the U.S. from the southern border.

title: Virginia's big blunder in March Madness upset to Furman has social media baffled: 'What are we doing?!?!?'
description: When University of Virginia guard Kihei Clark heaved a bad pass down court, the Furman Paladins seized an opportunity to pull off an upset. Social media reacted with amazement.

title: Missing Louisiana barge worker found dead in Mississippi River
description: The body of a missing Louisiana barge worker was pulled out of the Mississippi River. The man was reported missing on Feb. 7 after slipping off a barge while working.

title: New York police close to cracking decades-old murder of cop's daughter: 'We're coming for you'
description: New York State Police say they are close to making an arrest in the 2003 Orange County murder of 20-year-old Megan McDonald, daughter of an NYPD detective.

title: Oklahoma bombing co-conspirator's son pleads guilty to armed robbery and kidnapping in Nevada: report
description: Oklahoma City bombing co-conspirator Terry Nichols' son pleaded guilty to armed robbery and kidnapping this week for an incident in 2020 that occurred in Henderson, Nevada.

title: Jalen Carter, top NFL Draft prospect, pleads no contest to reckless driving, racing charges
description: Ex-Georgia standout Jalen Carter will not face any jail time after pleading no contest to misdemeanor charges related to a crash that resulted in the deaths of a teammates and staffer.

title: Biden education secretary rails against Republican-led 'book bans': Using education as a 'political football'
description: Biden Education Secretary Miguel Cardona criticized Republicans for book-banning, 'censorship,' and some pushes to cut education funding in a Tampa Bay Times guest column.

title: NFL star Joe Mixon avoids charges, but sister indicted in shooting outside running back's home
description: Joe Mixon's sister and her boyfriend have been indicted on charges stemming from shots that were fired from the running back's home earlier this month.

title: NATO mum in wake of Russia downing US drone; 'time to show steely resolve' says expert
description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg has yet to comment publicly on the downing of a U.S. MQ-9 Reaper drone by two Russian SU-27 fighter pilots this week.

title: Upcoming Superman movie restores 'American way' phrase to famous motto
description: Despite many pop culture battles over wokeness, the next Superman movie will tout the hero as the "embodiment of... the American way."

title: Biden reveals his March Madness picks for men's, women's college basketball
description: President Biden joined the masses Thursday, revealing his March Madness brackets for the NCAA men's and women's college basketball tournaments.

title: Kirk Cameron rejects drag queen story time, is instead speaking about faith, family at Arkansas library
description: Actor and writer Kirk Cameron will be in Fayetteville, Arkansas, along with his book publisher on Friday for a book reading event at the public library for families, sharing traditional values.

title: Eagles' Darius Slay tweets he is staying in Philadelphia: 'Back like I never left'
description: After a day-long discussion, the Eagles seemed to have found a way to keep five-time Pro Bowl defensive back Darius Slay with the team.

title: Large Russian city's anti-Putin former mayor jailed for 14 days pending trial
description: Former Yekaterinburg, Russia, Mayor Yevgeny Roizman, a prominent critic of President Vladimir Putin was ordered to spend 14 days in jail pending trial.

title: 7 killed in mysterious northern Iraq helicopter crash
description: Seven people were killed Wednesday night in a mysterious northern Iraq helicopter crash. The helicopter was carrying militants that belonged to the outlawed Kurdistan Worker's Party.

title: Montana attorney general to sue Biden administration over gun executive order
description: Republican Montana Attorney General Austin Knudsen is preparing a lawsuit to fight the Biden administration's over its gun violence executive order

title: Train hauling corn syrup derails in Arizona; no injuries reported
description: A freight train hauling corn syrup derailed in a rural, nonresidential area of Arizona. The cause of the derailment, which involved eight cars, is unknown.

title: NYC newspaper editor arrested for alleged police interference at Capitol riot
description: Elliot Resnick, former chief editor of the New York City-based Jewish Press, has been arrested for his alleged role in the Jan. 6, 2021 Capitol riot.

title: Tennessee looks at lowering permitless gun carry age to 18
description: Tennessee gun rights activists are pushing to lower the age limit for the state's permitless concealed carry law, and state officials appear open to possible legislation.

title: Def Leppard's drummer Rick Allen attacked by 19-year-old: police
description: Def Leppard drumer Rick Allen was attacked outside of a Florida hotel by a 19-year-old on March 13, according to a police report obtained by Fox News Digital.

title: Kamala Harris roasted for dodging Colbert's question on her role as VP: 'We're all wondering that'
description: "Outnumbered" panelists called Vice President Kamala Harris a "drag" on the administration and suggested she may not know what her responsibilities are.

title: Maryland overcomes slow start to bounce West Virginia from March Madness
description: Maryland overcame a slow start against West Virginia to win 67-65 in the first round of the NCAA Men's Basketball Tournament on Thursday.

title: Oklahoma man gets early release, commits triple homicide, cuts woman's heart out
description: Lawrence Paul Anderson had been serving a 20 year drug-related sentence, but was recommended for early release by the OK Pardon and Parole Board

title: Russian leadership ordered fighter jet pilots to be aggressive when intercepting US drone: sources
description: Russian leadership ordered Su-27 fighter jet pilots on Tuesday to be aggressive in intercepting the U.S. military drone that one jet collided with,

title: Christina Ricci claims she was threatened with lawsuit after refusing sex scene
description: Two-time Emmy-nominated actress Christina Ricci spoke out about being threatened with a lawsuit over her unwillingness to participate in a sex scene early in her career.

title: Minnesota Lt. Gov. ripped for saying parents must ‘believe’ when kids ‘tell us who they are’
description: Minnesota Lt. Gov. Peggy Flanagan, a Democrat, argued parents must "believe" their children when they "tell us who they are" in a now-viral clip.

title: Furman records first upset of 2023 March Madness, taking down Virginia with wild late sequence
description: After not leading for the first 35 minutes of the game and trailing by as many as 12 points, No. 13 Furman fought back for the first upset of March Madness.

title: Wellesley College says 'no plan' to revisit mission after students vote to admit trans men
description: Wellesley College officials responded after Tuesday's student vote to admit transgender men to the all-women institution, reiterating that the college still focuses on women.

title: NRCC drops ‘March to the Left Madness’ bracket as NCAA tournament kicks off
description: Fox News Digital exclusively obtained National Republican Congressional Committee's "March to the Left Madness" bracket as March Madness officially kicks off.

title: No charges for Detroit-area cop who shot armed suspect in police station lobby
description: A Dearborn, Michigan police officer will not be charged for killing Ali Naji, who entered a police station lobby in December and attempted to shoot him.

title: Georgia bill banning transgender surgeries on minors one step closer to becoming law
description: Georgia lawmakers have advanced a controversial bill that would ban sex-reassignment surgeries and hormone replacement therapies for gender dysphoric minors.

title: ND Supreme Court upholds injunction on state's plan to outlaw most abortions
description: The North Dakota Supreme Court on Thursday ruled that an injunction on a law banning all abortions not performed in rape, incest or life-threatening situations will remain in place.

title: Ben Affleck shares why he avoided working with Matt Damon
description: Ben Affleck opened up on his friendship with Matt Damon and why they haven't worked together as much since the success of "Good Will Hunting."

title: California church fights back after $2.8 million fine for defying COVID lockdown order
description: Calvary Chapel in Silicon Valley is counter-suing Santa Clara County over nearly $3 million in fines accumulated for violating COVID-19 lockdown orders.

title: Biden family received more than $1M from Hunter associate after 2017 China wire: House Oversight
description: Biden family members received more than $1 million in payments from accounts related to Hunter Biden’s business associate Rob Walker and their Chinese business ventures in 2017.

title: 'Jeopardy!' executive profusely apologizes for 'horrible error' that left fans fuming
description: "Jeopardy!" is trying to get back into the good graces of fans after a major editing flub that spoiled the winner of the game show at the beginning of the episode.

title: Lindsey Graham rebukes Ron DeSantis' Ukraine stance, says it's 'vitally important' to US interests
description: Sen. Lindsey Graham disputed Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' comments on Ukraine, arguing the conflict is 'vitally important' in keeping Putin's forces at bay

title: Russia flying more armed aircraft over US bases in Syria, US CENTCOM commander says
description: U.S. Central Command has observed a concerning rise in "unprofessional" and "unsafe" behavior from Russian aircraft pilots near U.S. bases in Syria.

title: Make Guinness stew, a spin on Irish potato soup, for St. Patrick's Day: Try the recipe
description: Celebrate St. Patrick’s Day with this 35-minute, easy-to-make recipe for Guinness stew, a fun spin on the traditional Irish potato soup. This dish serves five-to-seven people.

title: Bob Saget's widow Kelly Rizzo reveals the 'triggering' reason she sold their Brentwood home
description: Kelly Rizzo opened up about the recent sale of her Brentwood home with late husband Bob Saget, sharing what made her want to leave the house they shared.

title: Rescue operations at Colombia coal mine explosion end; 21 workers dead
description: Rescue officials at a coal mine explosion in Colombia found 21 workers dead; rescue operations have since come to a stop. The mine collapsed Tuesday following an explosion.

title: Chasten Buttigieg tells 'The View' it's an 'extremely dangerous time' with GOP 'book bans,' transgender laws
description: Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg's husband, Chasten Buttigieg, joined the hosts of "The View" on Thursday and said it was an "extremely dangerous time."

title: 2 police officers killed in Canadian city of Edmonton
description: Two police officers were killed while responding to a call in the Canadian city of Edmonton. No details were immediately released by the police following Thursday's incident.

title: Israeli army raid kills 4, including teenager, in West Bank
description: An Israeli army raid has killed four Palestinians Thursday in occupied West Bank. Israel frequently conducts military raids in the region of Jenin refugee camp.

title: Mets’ Edwin Diaz will need surgery after tearing patellar tendon in knee, could miss season
description: New York Mets closer Edwin Diaz suffered a tear of the patellar tendon in his right knee while celebrating Team Puerto Rico's win on Wednesday. Diaz will undergo surgery on Thursday.

title: Strikes, protests, and clashes over deadly Greek rail crash
description: Strikes, protests, and clashes broke out in Athens, Greece on Thursday during a strike over a rail disaster. The protesters threw gasoline bombs at police during the riots.

title: Kentucky lawmakers pass bill to make hazing a crime following student's death
description: Kentucky lawmakers passed a bill Thursday that will create new crimes to punish those responsible for hazing resulting in death. This bill follows the death of a student.

title: NASA sees active Venus volcano for first time ever
description: NASA said scientists have seen direct evidence of active volcanism on Venus for the first time, looking at images taken decades ago by the Magellan mission.

title: Investigation underway after AI tool may have misinterpreted a child’s disability as parental neglect
description: The U.S. child welfare system is under investigation for using an artificial intelligence tool that may have discriminated against people with disabilities.

title: Tourists visiting Rome’s Pantheon, Italy’s most-visited cultural site, to be charged a higher entrance fee
description: Rome’s Pantheon, Italy’s most-visited cultural site, will soon charge tourists an entrance fee. Foreign visitors over the age of 25 will have to pay $5.

title: US Army parachute team member dies in training accident in Florida
description: The United States Army is remembering a member of the parachute team who died after sustaining injuries during a training jump in Florida earlier this week.

title: Canadian pastor arrested second time for protesting children's drag queen events: 'Sick, twisted perversion'
description: Pastor Derek Reimer was arrested and charged for the second time within weeks after protesting drag queen story time for children at public libraries in Calgary, Alberta.

title: Missing 2.5 tons of Uranium has been recovered, Libyan army claims
description: The Libyan National Army claims to have recovered 2.5 tons of natural uranium that went missing last week, but the International Atomic Energy Agency has yet to verify.

title: 5 employees at high-end NJ mall revived after suspected fentanyl overdoses
description: Police in Hackensack, New Jersey, are investigating the source of the suspected fentanyl after five workers at The Shops at Riverside mall appeared to have overdosed.

title: Thai police to be subjected to random physical, mental health checks after standoff with officer
description: After a senior Thai police officer was involved in a 27-hour standoff before being subdued by fellow officers, Thai police must now undergo random physical and mental health checks.

title: House oversight chair Comer says ‘6 or 7 Biden family members’ potentially involved in business schemes
description: House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer says he believes at least half a dozen members of President Biden's family have been involved in “various business schemes” around the world.

title: Two arrested in connection with deadly Florida surf shop shooting: police
description: Two men are in custody after a man was shot and killed inside a surf shop in Clearwater, Florida, earlier this week, police say.

title: Marine Corps Commandant Gen. David Berger says there's 'zero evidence' DEI training distracts from readiness
description: U.S. Marine Corps Commandant Gen. David Berger said Thursday he has seen "zero evidence" that diversity, equity, and inclusion training programs are hurting readiness.

title: Flood warning in Sedona, Arizona, downgraded hours after issuing evacuation alerts
description: Hours after telling residents to evacuate immediately, a flood warning for the city of Sedona, Arizona, has been downgraded to an advisory.

title: Black mental patient pinned down, smothered to death by deputies at Virginia hospital, prosecutor says
description: A Black man who was handcuffed and shackled was smothered to death as he was getting admitted to a mental hospital in Virginia. Seven deputies were charged in the killing.

title: Wisconsin Republican lawmakers circulate bill that would designate an official state rifle
description: Lawmakers in Wisconsin have proposed a bill to designate an official state rifle. The bill proposes that the Henry All-Weather .45-70 become the official rifle of Wisconsin.

title: These 10 vehicles have the biggest markups at 20% and more
description: New car prices are rising and markups are down from last year, but several models are still being listed by dealers at 20% and more over their MSRP.

title: Tempers flare after GOP senator calls out Biden admin for lying about Social Security claim
description: Republicans and Democrats sparred in the Senate today over how willing President Biden is to meet with lawmakers to talk about saving Social Security.

title: Whiskey vs. Whisky: What's the difference between the liquors?
description: The difference between whiskey and whisky is a tiny but essential detail concerning the country where the brown liquor was produced. Here are details about the types of spirits.

title: EcoHealth Alliance: Controversial group back in the spotlight for alleged 'double billing' of Wuhan lab work
description: EcoHealth Alliance, a New York nonprofit, is back under a microscope following a report alleging they "double billed" two government agencies for Wuhan lab work.

title: North Carolina bipartisan agreement to expand Medicaid clears state Senate
description: The North Carolina state Senate has approved a bipartisan agreement to expand Medicaid coverage. The proposal could cover more low-income adults and build more health facilities.

title: Masters winner Scottie Scheffler hopeful golfers will table tensions for Champions Dinner as menu is unveiled
description: Scottie Scheffler said Wednesday that he does not expect the ongoing dispute between PGA Tour members and LIV Golf players to be an issue at this year’s Champions Dinner.

title: Ex-Detroit police officer sentenced to over 2 years for role in bribery case involving towing company
description: Former police officer Daniel Vickers was sentenced to over two years in prison for his role in a towing bribery scheme. Vickers accepted money in exchange for towing service referrals.

title: Texas man whose son helped dump mother's corpse convicted of killing wife, lover after catching them on camera
description: Jordy Husein Suljanovic was convicted of killing his wife and her lover in Texas, and Suljanovic's son, Jordy Suljanovic Jr., helped his father dispose of her body.

title: Dallas nightclub shooting leaves 2 dead, 1 injured
description: Two people are dead and one is injured after a shooting at Dallas nightclub in the Deep Ellum area. Authorities are still searching for the suspect.

title: Kentucky lawmakers pass bill giving parents the right to challenge 'obscene' content in schools
description: Kentucky lawmakers voted in favor of legislation that would give parents more say over what their child is being taught, including a formalized complaint process to challenge educational materials they believe to be 'harmful' to children

title: 'Never return': El Salvador locks up gang-bangers in new mega-prison with promise of no release
description: El Salvador's government has heavily publicized the new prison, providing video of each prison transfer so far, along with pictures extensively showing the inside of the facility.

title: Republican-dominated North Carolina Supreme Court may revive voter ID mandate
description: Mandating voter identification for elections in North Carolina was once struck down by Democrats, but may be revived now that Republicans hold a majority in the Supreme court.

title: ISIS group in Afghanistan could conduct 'external' attack against US in 6 months, US commander says
description: ISIS-K terrorists in Afghanistan could carry out an attack against U.S. interests and Western allies within six months "with little-to-no warning," a top U.S. commander says.

title: Attorney generals in some states refuse to release advisory opinions, while others post dozens each year
description: Attorney generals in about 20 percent of the states in the U.S. haven't posted any general opinions in the past few years, while other states post dozens each year.

title: North Carolina Democratic governor’s plan to increase spending by 20% scoffed at by Republicans
description: Democratic Gov. Roy Cooper’s big budget increase of 20% was scoffed at by the GOP. North Carolina’s Republicans originally favored an increase of around 10%.

title: Senior Iranian official visit UAE days after Tehran agrees to restore diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia
description: Days after Iran agreed to restore diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia in a deal brokered by China, a senior official from Iran, Ali Shamkhani, is visiting the United Arab Emirates.

title: 2 Michigan men convicted of fatally shooting 2 women who were unloading groceries outside their apartment
description: A jury convicted two men from Michigan of killing two women who were unloading groceries outside their suburban-Detroit apartment. An infant was discovered unharmed in the women's car.

title: Biden approves federal disaster declaration for New Hampshire following damage caused by December storm
description: A severe winter storm in New Hampshire downed trees and power lines causing numerous power outages in December. Biden officially declared a federal disaster declaration on Wednesday.

title: United States plans to defend Indo-Pacific region against coercion, bullying by authoritarian regimes
description: A military general from the United States claims the country plans to defend the Indo-Pacific region against coercion and bullying from authoritarian regimes.

title: Poland breaks up Russian spy ring suspected of planning attack on military supply routes to Ukraine
description: A Russian spy ring in southern Poland has been broken up after they were discovered to be planning an attack on military supply routes to Ukraine.

title: Jared Bridegan murder: Florida state attorney announces arrest in Microsoft exec's slaying
description: Authorities announced Thursday that the husband of slain Microsoft executive Jared Bridegan's ex-wife had been arrested for his murder in north Florida more than a year ago.

title: Mozambique records increase in cholera cases, Malawi sees decline as countries recover from Cyclone Freddy
description: The number of cholera cases in Malawi has declined in the past few weeks, while neighboring Mozambique has seen an increase in cases. Both countries were ravaged by Cyclone Freddy.

title: Senate Republicans introduce bill codifying right to bear arms 'outside your home'
description: Senate Republicans are pushing to codify court rulings ensuring that Americans can both own guns individually and carry them outside their homes for self-defense.

title: Germany needs step up against Russia and start pulling its weight in Ukraine
description: It has been more than a year since Russia invaded Ukraine. Several smaller countries have sent money to Ukraine but we are still waiting for Germany to contribute its fair share. Why?

title: China accuses US of suppressing TikTok, spreading disinformation
description: China accused the U.S. of suppressing TikTok and spreading disinformation following reports that the White House had called on TikTok's owner to sell its stakes in the popular platform.

title: Balancing the promise of new VR tech's X-Ray vision with privacy concerns
description: MIT has designed an augmented reality headset that essentially gives people "X-ray vision" to see through walls and inside boxes. Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson explains.

title: Theft suspect crashes helicopter at Sacramento Executive Airport in California, flees: police
description: Police and the FBI in California are searching for a suspect who crashed a helicopter at the Sacramento Executive Airport early Wednesday after attempting to steal the aircraft.

title: Audubon Society bucks critics, keeps 'enslaver' name despite criticism: 'Must reckon with the racist legacy'
description: Bird conservation group, the National Audubon Society, is refusing to change its historic name despite critics pointing to the "racist" background of its namesake.

title: 70-year-old man accused of scamming women on dating apps out of $1.8M
description: A 70-year-old New York City man is accused of scamming five women out of $1.8 million dollars. Nelson Counne is referred to as the "worst boyfriend on the Upper East Side."

title: DeSantis forms alliance with 18 governors to combat Biden's ESG push: 'Direct threat to the American economy'
description: Gov. Ron DeSantis is leading 18 states in combating the Biden administration's push on ESG investments, which they say could harm American retirement funds.

title: DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas parties with MSNBC honchos amid border crisis
description: DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas partied with MSNBC-ers at an event celebrating Jen Psaki’s new show, as Border Patrol admitted at a House hearing the border is in crisis.

title: Classic car theft foiled because crooks couldn't figure out how to drive it

description: The Biden administration's efforts to maximize energy efficiency of appliances through regulation could negatively impact consumers, according to experts and manufacturers.

description: Dalton Bolon, a seventh-year senior, leads the College of Charleston against San Diego State in Round 1 of the NCAA Tournament on Thursday.

description: Many Democrats and some Republicans who voted for the 2018 legislation rolling back Dodd-Frank received thousands in contributions from Silicon Valley Bank and its lobbyists prior to the vote.

description: Brittany Dawn Davis, a former fitness influencer facing trial for allegedly scamming clients who purchased her online nutrition program, is now organizing faith retreats.

description: Two police officials where charged with negligence after firing tear gas inside of a stadium leading to a crowd rush that killed 135. The officers were acquitted by an Indonesian court.

description: Prince William told two people who had experienced homelessness that his mother - who was a patron of homeless charities - would wish more progress had been made on the issue.

description: Arizona State raced out to a large lead at the half against Nevada in the First Four tournament game and won 98-73. D.J. Horne led the way with 20 points.

description: The Texas Senate unanimously passed a bill Wednesday that would allow the state to take legal action against those who traffic or distribute fentanyl in fatal cases.

description: "Beverly Hills, 90210" star Jennie Garth's rural upbringing was a far cry from her life as a 90s Hollywood starlet. Garth shared how she is carrying on her Midwestern values and traditions.

description: The NCAA Tournament kicks off Thursday with round 1, and there are 16 games throughout the day. Fox News highlights four games to watch.

description: Spring Canyon Middle School in Utah's Nebo School District said humans should eat bugs to protect the environment from climate change disaster wrought by cows.

description: Authorities said a train carrying hazardous materials derailed just north of Lake Havasu City, Arizona, near the border with California. An investigation is ongoing.

description: Wyndi Adkins of Blooming Grove, Texas, is a quadruple amputee. She credits her faith in God, the love of her family and her little Chiweenie, Mazi, for keeping her alive and giving her purpose.

description: The New York City Police Department was hit with criticism for axing a timed run for recruits to allegedly allow more women to join the force following an exodus of officers.

description: President Biden's numerous blunders continued into February and March as he committed more embarrassing gaffes in speeches and during trips.

description: Jeremy Renner shared a photo of a handwritten note his nephew sent him as he continues to undergo physical therapy and recover from a severe snowplow accident in January.

title: Texas DPS warnings about travel to Mexico are changing plans for some spring breakers
description: The Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) is urging Texans to avoid traveling to Mexico during spring break due to ongoing violence crossing the U.S.-Mexico border.

title: Virginia man arrested for shining laser pointer at police helicopter during pursuit
description: A man in northern Virginia was arrested last week after shining a laser pointer at a Fairfax County police helicopter while it helped Virginia State Police pursue a suspect on the run.

description: Republican Utah Gov. Spencer Cox signed a law Wednesday which will ban abortion clinics next year, pending potential legal challenges as the state navigates the post-Roe legal landscape.

title: On this day in history, March 16, 1802, United States Military Academy established at West Point
description: The United States Military Academy at West Point was created by the Military Peace Establishment Act, signed by President Jefferson, on this day in history, March 16, 1802.
